definitions.definition: to exchange one thing for another thing, especially of a similar type:

examples: I almost didn't recognize her - she'd changed so much.

definitions.definition: to take something you have bought back to a shop and exchange it for something else:
examples: I had to change those trousers I bought for (= take them back to the shop in order to get) a bigger pair.

definitions.definition: to form a new opinion or make a new decision about something that is different from your old one:
examples: If you change your mind about coming tonight, just give me a call.
Her attitude has definitely changed for the better since she started this new job.

definitions.definition: to improve the bad parts of your behaviour:
examples: If he wants to carry on living here, he's going to have to change his ways and learn to be a bit less messy.

definitions.definition: the act of becoming different, or the result of something becoming different:
examples: Let me know if there's any change in the situation.

definitions.definition: something that is pleasant or interesting because it is unusual or new:
examples: It's nice to see her smile for a change.
She'd been with the same company for too many years and felt she needed a change of scene, so she applied for a job as a stage manager.
